intro: Paronychia ahartii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its roots are deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Paronychia ahartii is well adapted to harsh environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
